summary: This is an email chain between federal prosecutors and law enforcement officials discussing the urgent scheduling of interviews with individuals calling from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) who have a grand jury date the next day. The emails emphasize the need to coordinate availability for interviews requiring both OIG and FBI presence, and to work around scheduling conflicts.

events.title: Grand jury date for MCC individuals
events.description: Individuals calling from the Metropolitan Correctional Center have a scheduled grand jury date.

keyFacts: The email chain is dated August 19-20, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
Individuals associated with the Epstein investigation are calling from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) and have a grand jury date scheduled for the next day (August 20, 2019).
The scheduling of interviews is urgent and requires coordination between the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and the FBI.
The correspondence indicates active investigative steps were being taken in the immediate aftermath of Epstein's death.
All specific names of senders and recipients in the email headers are redacted in the provided text.
